attach.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to fasten or connect one object to another
attach.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Please fill in and return the attached reply slip.
Attach a recent photograph to your application form.
a small battery attached to a little loudspeaker
attach.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if blame attaches or is attached to someone, they are responsible for something bad that happens
attach.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: No blame can be attached to Roy for the incident.
attach.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if a quality, feeling, idea etc attaches or is attached to a person, thing, or event, it is connected with them
attach.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Itâ€™s easy to let the emotions attached to one situation spill over into others.
attach.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to connect a document or file  to an email so that you can send them together
attach.translation[1].definitions[0].def: if conditions are attached to an agreement, they are added to it and made a part of it
attach.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The US government has attached conditions to economic aid.
attach.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if there are benefits, rights etc attached to something, they are associated with that thing
attach.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Few companies have chosen to use tax advantages attached to the revaluation.
attach.translation[1].definitions[2].def: if a letter or document is attached to something, it is sent with it
attach.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: information given in a memo attached to his tax return
